fields.value: Replication data for: International Criminal Defense: The Influence of Attorney Background on Judicial Decision Making at the International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda

publicationCitation.value: Meernik, James and Christopher Fariss. 2006. International Criminal Defense: The Influence of Attorney Background on Judicial Decision Making at the International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda. Judicature 89(6): 326-333 (May-June 2006).

Meernik, James and Christopher Fariss. 2006. International Criminal Defense: The Influence of Attorney Background on Judicial Decision Making at the International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda. Judicature 89(6): 326-333 (May-June 2006).

King. 2010 The Impact of International Tribunals and Domestic Trials on Peace and Human Rights After Civil War. International Studies Perspectives. 11(4): 309-334.  Meernik, James and Rosa Aloisi. 2008. Is justice delayed at the International Criminal Tribunals? Judicature, 91(6): 276-287.  Meernik, James, Kimi L. King and Geoff Dancy. 2005. value: Updated data to analyze the decisions made by the International Criminal Tribunal for the Former Yugoslavia, the International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda and the Special Court for Sierra Leone is available here:  http://www.psci.unt.edu/~meernik/International%20Criminal%20Tribunals%20Website.htm
